externalDocs.description: Found an error? Let us know.
Found an error? Let us know.

get.description: Returns a list of teams bound to a organization.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization for which the teams should be listed.

post.description: Create a new team bound to an organization. Only the name of the team is needed to create it, the slug can be auto generated.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team should be created for.

slug.description: The optional slug for this team. If not provided it will be auto generated from the name

get.description: Return details on an individual team.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team belongs to.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to get.

put.description: Update various attributes and configurable settings for the given team.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team belongs to.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to get.

name.description: The new name for the team.

slug.description: A new slug for the team. It has to be unique and available.

delete.description:
Schedules a team for deletion.

Note: Deletion happens asynchronously and therefor is not immediate. However once deletion has begun the state of a project changes and will be hidden from most public views.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team belongs to.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to get.

get.description: Return a list of projects bound to a team.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team belongs to.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to get.

post.description: Create a new project bound to a team.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team belongs to.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to create a new project for.

name.description: The name for the new project.

slug.description: Optionally a slug for the new project. If it’s not provided a slug is generated from the name.

get.summary:
Caution
This endpoint may change in the future without notice.
get.description:
Return a set of points representing a normalized timestamp and the number of events seen in the period.

Query ranges are limited to Sentry’s configured time-series resolutions.
get.operationId: Retrieve Event Counts for a Team

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization the team belongs to.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to get.

parameters.name: stat
parameters.description: the name of the stat to query `("received", "rejected")`

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: A timestamp to set the start of the query in seconds since UNIX epoch.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: A timestamp to set the end of the query in seconds since UNIX epoch.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: An explicit resolution to search for (one of `10s`, `1h`, and `1d`).

get.description: Return a list of organizations available to the authenticated session.  This is particularly useful for requests with an user bound context.  For API key based requests this will only return the organization that belongs to the key.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: restrict results to organizations in which you are an organization owner

get.description: This resolves an event ID to the project slug and internal issue ID and internal event ID.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the slug of the organization the event ID should be looked up in.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: the event ID to look up.

get.description: Return details on an individual organization including various details such as membership access, features, and teams.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the slug of the organization to look up.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist

put.description: Update various attributes and configurable settings for the given organization.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the organization to update.

name.description: an optional new name for the organization.

slug.description: an optional new slug for the organization. Needs to be available and unique.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist

get.description: Return a list of projects bound to a organization.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the slug of the organization for which the projects should be listed.

get.description: Return a list of version control repositories for a given organization.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the organization short name

get.description: Return a list of commits for a given repository.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the organization short name

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.description: the repository ID

example.message: Initial commit from Create Next App

get.summary:
Caution
This endpoint may change in the future without  notice.
get.description: Return a set of points representing a normalized timestamp and the number of events seen in the period.
get.operationId: Retrieve Event Counts for an Organization

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the slug of the organization the event ID should be looked up in.

parameters.name: stat
parameters.description: the name of the stat to query `("received", "rejected", "blacklisted")`

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: A timestamp to set the start of the query in seconds since UNIX epoch.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: A timestamp to set the end of the query in seconds since UNIX epoch.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: An explicit resolution to search for (one of `10s`, `1h`, and `1d`).

get.description: Return a list of users that belong to a given organization.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the slug of the organization the event ID should be looked up in.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: restrict results to users who have access to a given project ID

get.description: This resolves a short ID to the project slug and internal issue ID.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: the slug of the organization the short ID should be looked up in.

parameters.name: short_id
parameters.description: the short ID to look up.
